main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported over Birmingham, Alabama in 1952, with descriptions of pale blue lights, oval-shaped objects, and circular silver or white objects moving at high speeds and displaying unusual behavior.
interesting points: The UFOs were observed by a Commercial Airlines pilot and co-pilot who reported that the object followed their aircraft before accelerating and pulling away at a tremendous rate of speed.
The observed objects were described as elliptical or oval in shape, about 30 to 40 feet in diameter, and moving at a high rate of speed by multiple witnesses.
A natural celestial phenomenon explanation was suggested for one sighting, but no definitive identification was made.
The objects were reported to be considerably brighter than typical aircraft lights and displaying unusual behavior such as sudden acceleration and high maneuverability.
The sightings were recorded by multiple military and civilian sources, including Air Force reservists, and were not attributed to any known conventional aircraft or missile.
sighted object: pale blue lights, oval-shaped objects, and circular silver or white objects
